Pelaku Industri Nilai Harga Gas Harus Dikaji Ulang
06 Nov 2019, 21:20 by Fitratun KOmariah


Pelaku Industri Nilai Harga Gas Harus Dikaji Ulang

KBRN, Jakarta : PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk ( PGN ) sempat berencana menaikkan harga gas. Usulan itu tentunya membuat masyarakat resah dan menuai protes dari kalangan industri.
Namun, akhirnya usulan tersebut ditunda sampai minimal akhir tahun. Kenaikan harga gas dinilai akan memukul industri tertentu yang sensitif terhadap kenaikan perubahan harga tersebut. 
Wakil Ketua Umum Kadin Bidang Agro dan Kimia Industri, Achmad Widjaja mengatakan, harga gas yang ditetapkan PGN sifatnya masih ditahan, dan belum dibatalkan.
"Kita mengharapkan saat posisi sekarang, di kala Pemerintah sudah yakin bahwa PP No 40 Tahun 2016 itu sudah bagus dan benar. Itu harusnya dijalankan sehingga kenaikan itu dibatalkan bukannya ditahan," ujar Achmad saat ditemui di Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Ia menilai Rencana kenaikan gas ini perlu dikaji ulang, boleh menaikkan harga gas asal PGN bersedia duduk bersama untuk membicarakan hal ini.
Ketentuan Peraturan Presiden No 40 Tahun 2016 Tentang Penetapan Harga Gas Bumi menyebutkan bahwa harga gas di sektor industri tidak boleh di atas 6 USD per mbbtu.
Namun rupanya peraturan itu tidak pernah diimplementasikan sampai saat ini. Dalam kurun waktu tiga tahun, pemerintah tidak pernah menjalankan Perpres tersebut. Sehingga tidak ada kepastian hukum yang diterima dari kalangan industri untuk menetapkan harga gas.
Sementara itu, menurut informasi yang diperoleh dari mantan Anggota Komisi VII DPR RI Fraksi Partai NasDem, Dr. Kurtubi mengatakan, sekarang ini para pelaku usaha di kalangan industri membayar gas mencapai 10 US dollar per mbbtu.
Apabila rencana harga gas dinaikkan, maka Ia khawatir kalangan industri harus membayar gas lebih mahal, sebesar 12-13 US Dollar. Hal ini tentu bertentangan dengan Peraturan Presiden Nomor 40 Tahun 2016.
"Umumnya harga gas di Jawa Barat yang langsung dari pipa itu sekitar 9 USD. Kemudian di Jawa Timur 8 USD, karena pipanya lebih pendek. Kalau di Sumatera karna pipanya panjang dan kebetulan sumbernya berkurang sekarang malah harganya 9.95 tapi industri bayarnya lebih dari 10 dollar," kata Kurtubi di Jakarta. Rabu (6/11/2019).

Industry Players Value of Gas Prices Must Be Re-examined
Nov 6 2019, 21:20 by Fitratun KOmariah


Industry Players Value of Gas Prices Must Be Re-examined

KBRN, Jakarta: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) had planned to raise gas prices. The proposal certainly made people uneasy and drew protests from industry circles.
However, finally the proposal was postponed until at least the end of the year. The increase in gas prices is considered to hit certain industries that are sensitive to the increase in price changes.
Deputy Chairman of Kadin for Agro and Chemical Industry, Achmad Widjaja said, the gas price set by PGN was still being held, and had not been canceled.
"We expect the current position, when the Government is convinced that PP No. 40 of 2016 is already good and correct. It should be implemented so that the increase is canceled instead of being detained," Achmad said when met in Jakarta on Wednesday (11/06/2019) .
He considered the plan to increase the gas needs to be reviewed, may increase the price of gas from PGN, willing to sit together to discuss this.
The provisions of Presidential Regulation No. 40 Year 2016 concerning the Determination of Natural Gas Prices states that the price of gas in the industrial sector must not be above 6 USD per mbbtu.
But apparently the regulation was never implemented until now. In a period of three years, the government never implemented the Perpres. So there is no legal certainty received from industry to set gas prices.
Meanwhile, according to information obtained from a former Member of the House of Representatives Commission VII of the NasDem Party Faction, Dr. Kurtubi said that currently business players in the industry pay gas reaching 10 US dollars per mbbtu.
If the gas price plan is raised, he is worried that the industry must pay more expensive gas, amounting to 12-13 US Dollars. This is certainly contrary to Presidential Regulation Number 40 of 2016.
"Generally, the price of gas in West Java directly from the pipeline is around 9 USD. Then in East Java it is 8 USD, because the pipe is shorter. If in Sumatra because the pipe is long and incidentally the source is reduced now the price is 9.95 but the industry pays more than 10 dollars. "said Kurtubi in Jakarta. Wednesday (11/06/2019).
